main event: A bright reddish-white object was seen changing to bright orange, climbing to the west and then descending with no trail. The intensity of the light lit up the cockpit of the C-133A aircraft.
interesting points: The object was first observed as green, then changed to violet, and then orange before exploding just before entering the undercast at an estimated altitude of 12,000 to 12,220 feet.
The explosion of the object was bright enough to light up the cockpit and attract the attention of the crew members who were not facing the light.
Another aircraft, the C-133A 62027, also reported sighting a similar object at 0315Z, with the same color changes and explosion before entering the cloud tops.
The object was sighted over the coordinates 56째43'N 41째10'W.
The sighting was reported to various military and government agencies, including NORAD, the Canadian Air Defense Command, and the U.S. Air Force.
sighted object: Bright reddish-white object, changing to bright orange
photographs: No photographs included in the report
